name: 20th Century
method: Shake in an iced cocktail shaker, and strain into a cocktail glass. Garnish with a lemon twist.

name: 7 and 7
method: Pour whiskey into Collins glass filled with ice. Fill to desired level with 7 Up. Stir lightly.

name: Agent Orange
method: Mix in an old fashioned glass with ice and serve.

name: Agua de Sevilla
method: Recipes instruct to crush the ice until it is shaved and serve in champagne glasses with a leaf of hierba buena.

name: Agua de Valencia
method: Add all ingredients to a pitcher. Adjust sugar to taste. Refrigerate

name: Alabama Slammer
method: Pour into collins glass over rocks. Stir.

name: Amber Moon
method: Crack an egg into a tall glass, leaving the yolk unbroken. Pour in whiskey. Add Tabasco to taste, or serve on the side.

name: Americano
method: Pour the Campari and vermouth over ice into glass, add a splash of soda water and garnish with half orange slice.

name: Angel Face
method: Shake all ingredients with ice and strain contents into a cocktail glass.

name: Aperol Spritz
method: Add 3 parts prosecco, 2 parts Aperol and top up with soda water, garnish with a slice of orange and serve.

name: Appletini
method: Mix in a shaker, then pour into a chilled glass. Garnish and serve.

name: Aviation
method: Add all ingredients into cocktail shaker filled with ice. Shake well and strain into cocktail glass. Garnish with a cherry.

name: B and B
method: Combine and stir.

name: B-52
method: Layer ingredients into a shot glass. Serve with a stirrer.

name: Baby Guinness
method: Float Irish cream on top of coffee liqueur

name: Bacardi
method: Shake together with ice. Strain into glass and serve

name: Bananarita
method: Fill the glass halfway (6oz.) with ice. Pour the tequila to the rim of the ice. Add the 99 Bananas liquor as well as the margarita mix; finish by adding the garnishes.

name: Barracuda
method: Shake ingredients with ice. Strain into glass, top with Sparkling wine.

name: Batida
method: Mix and pour into chilled glass.

name: Bee's Knees
method: Shake with ice and strain into a chilled large cocktail glass

name: Bellini
method: Pour peach purée into chilled flute, add sparkling wine. Stir gently.

name: Between the Sheets
method: Pour all ingredients into shaker with ice cubes, shake, strain into chilled cocktail glass.

name: Bijou
method: Stir in mixing glass with ice and strain

name: Black Russian
method: Pour the ingredients into an old fashioned glass filled with ice cubes. Stir gently.

name: Black Velvet
method: Mix equal parts stout and Champagne

name: Bloodhound
method: Shake alcoholic ingredients and serve over crushed ice with strawberry coulis and strawberries garnish

name: Bloody Mary
method: Stirring gently, pour all ingredients into highball glass. Garnish.

name: Blow Job
method: Pour ½ oz Baileys and ½ oz Kahlúa in shot glass. Then slowly pour in ¼ oz amaretto (creating a layered look) and top with whipped cream. Serve.

name: Blue Hawaii
garnish: Pineapple or orange quarter slice, maraschino cherry
method: Combine all ingredients with ice, stir or shake, then pour into a hurricane glass with the ice. For garnish score pineapple or orange slice with a knife and insert onto rim of glass; optionally use toothpick or cocktail umbrella to spear maraschino cherry through center and attach to top of fruit slice; otherwise float cherry on top of ice!

name: Blue Lagoon
method: Pour vodka and blue curacao in a shaker with ice, shake well & strain into ice filled highball glass, top with lemonade, garnish and serve.

name: Blueberry Tea

ingredients.name: Hot Orange pekoe tea to taste

method: Add both liqueurs to the snifter and then fill with hot tea to taste. Swaddle the brandy snifter in serviettes or a cloth to protect the hands. Some suggest a sugared rim, or adding sugar to the tea, or a lemon garnish.

name: Bobby Burns
method: Put all liquid ingredients in cocktail shaker filled with ice. Squeeze lemon peel on top. Shake, strain into glass.

name: Boulevardier
method: Stir with ice, strain, garnish and serve.

name: Bourbon Lancer
method: Build over ice; stir. Garnish with twist of lemon peel.

name: Bramble
method: Fill glass with crushed ice. Build gin, lemon juice and simple syrup over. Stir, and then pour blackberry liqueur over in a circular fashion to create marbling effect. Garnish with two blackberries and lemon slice.

name: Brandy Alexander
method: Shake all ingredients with ice and strain contents into a cocktail glass. Sprinkle nutmeg on top and serve.

name: Brandy Daisy
method: Stir well with cracked ice in a cocktail shaker, then strain into a chilled Collins glass and top with a splash of chilled club soda or seltzer.

name: Brandy Sour (Cyprus)
method: Stir into glass over ice, garnish and serve.

name: Brass Monkey
method: Stir together and serve over ice.

name: Brave Bull
method: Fill old fashioned glass with ice. Pour 1½ oz tequila and 1/2 oz Kahlúa. Serve.

name: Breakfast Martini
method: Mix or shake in cocktail shaker filled with ice cubes. Strain into glass and serve.

name: Bronx
method: Pour into cocktail shaker all ingredients with ice cubes, shake well. Strain in chilled cocktail or martini glass.

name: Brooklyn

ingredients.name: 1/4 oz Amer Picon or a few dashes of Angostura bitters

method: Stirred over ice, strained into a chilled glass, garnished, and served straight up.

name: Buck's Fizz
method: Pour the orange juice into glass and top up Champagne. Stir gently, garnish and serve.

name: Bumbo
method: Mix and garnish.

name: Bushwacker
method: Blend all the ingredients together in a blender, including the ice, and then strain into a hurricane glass. Place cherry on top of the drink as a garnish and serve. Whipped cream can also be added as a garnish to the top of the drink before the cherry.

name: Caesar
garnish: Stalk of celery, wedge of lime
method: Rim glass with celery salt, and a lime wedge.

name: Caipirinha
method: Place lime and sugar into old fashioned glass and muddle (mash the two ingredients together using a muddler or a wooden spoon). Fill the glass with crushed ice and add the Cachaça.

name: Caju Amigo
method: The slice is placed on the tongue and chased by the shot of cachaça. Or the two ingredients are mixed in a shot glass and served straight.

name: Cape Codder
method: Build all ingredients in a highball glass filled with ice. Garnish with lime wedge.

name: Carrot Cake
method: Layer ingredients in a shot glass.

name: Casino
method: Pour all ingredients into shaker with ice cubes. Shake well. Strain into chilled cocktail glass. Garnish with a lemon twist and a maraschino cherry. Serve without a straw.

name: Champagne Cocktail
method: Add dash of Angostura bitter onto sugar cube and drop it into champagne flute. Add cognac followed by gently pouring chilled champagne. Garnish with orange slice and maraschino cherry.

name: Chimayó Cocktail
method: Pour the tequila and unfiltered apple cider into glass over ice. Add the lemon juice and creme de cassis and stir. Garnish and serve.

name: Churchill
method: Shake ingredients together with ice, and strain into a cocktail glass.

name: Clover Club
method: Dry shake ingredients to emulsify, add ice, shake and served straight up.

name: Cojito
method: In a shaker add white rum, Malibu, lime juice, some mint leaves and crushed ice, garnish with the sprig of mint.

name: Colombia
method: Shake the vodka and citrus juices in a mixer, then strain into the glass. Slide the grenadine down one side of the glass, where it will sink to the bottom. Slide the curacao down the other side, to lie between the vodka and grenadine, and serve before the layers have a chance to mix.

name: Common Market
method: Shake ingredients together with ice, and strain into a cocktail glass.

name: Corn N' Oil
method: Pour the rum and falernum into a glass over ice and stir well. Squeeze in the lime wedge(s) and drop it in.

name: Corpse Reviver #2
method: Shake ingredients together in a mixer with ice. Strain into chilled glass.

name: Corpse Reviver
method: Stir with ice, strain into a chilled cocktail glass.

name: Cosmopolitan
method: Add all ingredients into cocktail shaker filled with ice. Shake well and double strain into large cocktail glass. Garnish with lime wheel.

name: Cuba Libre
method: Build all ingredients in a Collins glass filled with ice. Garnish with lime wedge.

name: Culto A La Vida
method: Mixing in the glass. Dissolve sugar in lime. Add ice, cranberry and run.

name: Daiquiri
method: Pour all ingredients into shaker with ice cubes. Shake well. Strain in chilled cocktail glass.

name: Damn the Weather
method: Shake with ice and strain into a chilled large cocktail glass

name: Dark 'N' Stormy
method: In a highball glass filled with ice add 6cl dark rum and top with ginger beer. Garnish with lime wedge.

name: Derby
method: Pour all ingredients into a mixing glass with ice. Stir. Strain into a cocktail glass. Garnish with a sprig of fresh mint in the drink.

name: Dirty Martini
method: Straight: Pour all ingredients into mixing glass with ice cubes. Stir well. Strain in chilled martini cocktail glass. Squeeze oil from lemon peel onto the drink, or garnish with olive.

name: Dirty Mother
method: Fill old fashioned glass with ice. Pour 1½ oz brandy and 1/2 oz Kahlúa. Serve.

name: Dry Martini
method: Straight: Pour all ingredients into mixing glass with ice cubes. Stir well. Strain in chilled martini cocktail glass. Squeeze oil from lemon peel onto the drink, or garnish with olive.

name: El Presidente
method: Stir well with ice, then strain into glass. Garnish and serve.

name: Espresso Martini
method: Pour ingredients into shaker filled with ice, shake vigorously, and strain into chilled martini glass

name: Farnell
garnish: Lime wedge and a sprig of mint
method: Pour Jack Daniel's into Collins glass filled with ice. Fill to desired level with lemonade. Stir lightly and garnish with lime and mint.

name: Fish House Punch
method: Stir together sugar and 3½ cups water in a large bowl or pot until sugar is dissolved. Add lemon juice, rum, cognac, and brandy and chill, covered, at least 3 hours. Put half-gallon ice block in a punch bowl and pour punch over it.

name: Fizzy Apple Cocktail
method: Combine all three ingredients into a chilled glass and serve with ice and garnish.

name: Flaming Doctor Pepper
method: Layer the two spirits in the shot glass, with the high-proof liquor on top. Light the shot and allow it to burn; then extinguish it by dropping it into the beer glass. Drink immediately.

name: Flaming Volcano
garnish: Pineapple and/or orange quarter slices, maraschino cherries
method: Combine all ingredients except the overproof rum with 2 scoops of crushed ice in a blender, blend briefly, then pour into the "volcano bowl". Pour some overproof rum into the central crater of the volcano bowl and light it. For garnish score pineapple or orange slices with a knife and insert onto rim of bowl; optionally add maraschino cherries to the main drink. Multiply recipe to adjust to the size of the container (e.g. x2 for a 32-US-fluid-ounce (950 ml) volcano bowl).

name: Flirtini
method: Build ingredients in glass over ice. Stir

name: Fluffy Critter
method: Mix all ingredients in a highball glass.

name: Four Horsemen
method: Mix the four spirits together into the shot glass, and down immediately.

name: Four Score
method: Stir together with ice, strain into glass, garnish with a twisted lemon rind

name: French 75
method: Combine gin, syrup, and lemon juice in a cocktail shaker filled with ice. Shake vigorously and strain into a chilled champagne glass. Top up with Champagne. Stir gently.

name: French Connection
method: Pour all ingredients directly into old fashioned glass filled with ice cubes. Stir gently.

name: French Martini
method: Pour all ingredients into shaker with ice cubes. Shake well and strain into a chilled cocktail glass. Squeeze oil from lemon peel onto the drink.

name: Fuzzy Navel
method: Add all ingredients to a highball glass. Stir.

name: Gibson
method: Stir well in a shaker with ice, then strain into a chilled martini glass. Garnish and serve

name: Gimlet
method: Mix and serve. Garnish with a slice of lime

name: Gin Fizz
method: Shake all ingredients with ice cubes, except soda water. Pour into glass. Top with soda water.

name: Ginza Mary
method: Combine ingredients and cracked ice, mix, pour into chilled Old Fashioned Glass

name: Godfather
method: Pour all ingredients directly into old fashioned glass filled with ice cubes. Stir gently.

name: Godmother
method: Pour all ingredients directly into old fashioned glass filled with ice cubes. Stir gently.

name: Golden Doublet
method: Shake ingredients together with ice, and strain into champagne cocktail glass, and fill with champagne.

name: Golden Dream
method: Shake with cracked ice. Strain into glass and serve.

name: Grasshopper
method: Pour ingredients into a cocktail shaker with ice. Shake briskly and then strain into a chilled cocktail glass.

name: Greyhound
method: Mix gin and juice, pour over ice in Old Fashioned glass

name: Gunfire
method: Make the tea. Pour in rum and stir.

name: Hanky Panky
method: Shake with ice. Strain into cocktail glass. Garnish by squeezing an orange peel over the top.

name: Harrogate Nights
method: Fill a Highball glass with ice then add a dash of cranberry juice. Add the rest of the ingredients to the Boston glass, shake and strain into the Highball glass. Garnish and serve.

name: Harvey Wallbanger
method: Stir the vodka and orange juice with ice in the glass, then float the Galliano on top. Garnish and serve.

name: Havana Cooler
method: Muddle rum with mint. Add ice and top with ginger ale

name: Hemingway Special
method: Shake all ingredients with ice and strain contents into a cocktail glass.

name: Herbsaint Frappé
method: Stir together with plenty of ice, then strain into a very well chilled glass. Serve very cold.

name: Horse's Neck
method: Pour brandy and ginger ale directly into highball glass with ice cubes. Stir gently. Garnish with lemon zest. If desired, add dashes of Angostura Bitter.

name: Hurricane
method: Shake ingredients with ice, then pour into the glass and serve over ice.

name: Incredible Hulk
method: Stir together and serve over ice.

name: Irish Car Bomb
drinkware: A pint glass and a shot glass
method: The whiskey is floated on top of the Irish cream in a shot glass, and the shot glass is then dropped into the stout

name: Irish Coffee
method: Heat the coffee, whiskey and sugar; do not boil. Pour into glass and top with cream; serve hot.

name: Jack Rose
method: Traditionally shaken into a chilled glass, garnished, and served straight up.

name: Japanese Slipper
method: Shake together in a mixer with ice. Strain into glass, garnish and serve.

name: Jägerbomb
method: Pour red bull into pint glass half filling it. Drop a shot glass full of Jägermeister in

name: John Collins
method: Pour all ingredients directly into highball glass filled with ice. Stir gently. Garnish. Add a dash of Angostura bitters.

name: Juan Collins
method: Pour the tequila, lemon juice, and nectar into a collins glass over ice, stir. Add splash of club soda and garnish with lime and cherry.

name: Kalimotxo
method: Stir together over plenty of ice.

name: Kamikaze
method: Shake all ingredients together with ice. Strain into glass, garnish and serve.

name: Kensington Court Special
method: Shake ingredients together with ice, and strain into a cocktail glass.

name: Kentucky Corpse Reviver
method: Shake ingredients together with ice, and strain into a glass. Garnish with mint sprig.

name: Kir Royal
method: Add the crème de cassis to the bottom of the glass, then top up champagne.

name: Kir
method: Add the crème de cassis to the bottom of the glass, then top up with wine.

name: Leite de Onça
method: Mix the condensed milk and the milk until they blend together. Add cachaça and let it rest. Add cocoa licor when it's ready to serve

name: Lemon Drop Martini
method: Shake and strain into a chilled cocktail glass rimmed with sugar.

name: Link Up
method: Shake well, serve on the rocks.

name: Long Island Iced Tea
method: Add all ingredients into highball glass filled with ice. Stir gently. Garnish with lemon spiral. Serve with straw.

name: Lorraine
method: Stir with ice, strain into glass, and serve.

name: Lynchburg Lemonade
method: Shake first 3 ingredients with ice and strain into ice-filled glass. Top with the lemonade or lemon-lime. Add ice and stir. Garnish with lemon slices and cherries.

name: Macuá
method: Blend the ingredients with 1 cup of ice and serve well chilled. Garnish with an orange slice

name: Mai Tai
garnish: Pineapple spear, Mint leaves, Lime peel
method: Shake all ingredients with ice. Strain into glass. Garnish and serve with straw.

name: Manhattan
method: Stirred over ice, strained into a chilled glass, garnished, and served up.

name: Margarita
method: Rub the rim of the glass with the lime slice to make the salt stick to it. Take care to moisten only the outer rim and sprinkle the salt on it. The salt should present to the lips of the imbiber and never mix into the cocktail. Shake the other ingredients with ice, then carefully pour into the glass.

name: Mary Pickford
method: Shake and strain into a chilled large cocktail glass

name: Matador
method: Mix the ingredients in a shaker half full of ice. Strain and serve in a chilled cocktail glass or champagne flute.

name: Mimosa
method: Ensure both ingredients are well chilled, then mix into the glass. Serve cold.

name: Mint Julep
method: In a highball glass gently muddle the mint, sugar and water. Fill the glass with cracked ice, add Bourbon and stir well until the glass is well frosted. Garnish with a mint sprig.

name: Missouri Mule
method: Shake ingredients together with ice, and strain into a cocktail glass.

name: Mojito
method: Muddle mint leaves with sugar and lime juice. Add a splash of soda water and fill the glass with cracked ice. Pour the rum and top with soda water. Garnish and serve with straw.

name: Monkey Gland
method: Shake well over ice cubes in a shaker, strain into a chilled cocktail glass.

name: Moonwalk
method: Shake well, strain into wine glass and top up with champagne.

name: Moscow Mule
method: Combine vodka and ginger beer in a highball glass filled with ice. Add lime juice. Stir gently. Garnish.

name: My Fair Lady
method: Shake ingredients together with ice, and strain into a cocktail glass.

name: Negroni
method: Stir into glass over ice, garnish and serve.

name: Nikolaschka
method: Pour cognac into brandy snifter, place lemon disk across the top of the glass and top with sugar and coffee.

name: Nixon
garnish: A slice of peach and a cherry
method: Stir and serve on the rocks, garnish.

name: Old Etonian
method: Shake with ice and strain into a stemmed cocktail glass.

name: Old Fashioned
method:
Place sugar cube in old fashioned glass and saturate with bitters, add a dash of plain water.

Muddle until dissolved.
Fill the glass with ice cubes and add whiskey.
Garnish with orange twist, and a cocktail cherry.

name: Old Pal
method: Mix the 3 ingredients in a mixing glass, and add ice. Stir to chill, and strain into a cocktail glass

name: Orange Tundra
method: In a glass without stirring add in order: vodka, cream, soda, coffee liqueur, orange juice. Serve immediately

name: Orgasm
method: Build all ingredients over ice in an old fashioned glass or shot glass.

name: Ouzini
method: Shake ouzo and fresh orange juice vigorously together, pour into glass over ice, and add dash of bitters. Garnish with a thin orange slice and serve.

name: Painkiller
method: Shake ingredients. Sprinkly nutmeg over top to garnish.

name: Paloma
method: Stir together and serve over ice.

name: Paradise
method: Shake together over ice. Strain into cocktail glass and serve chilled.

name: Pegu Club
method: Shake ingredients together in a mixer with crushed ice. Strain into chilled glass, garnish and serve.

name: Pink Gin
method: Chill the glass, then coat the inside with the Bitters. Add the gin very well chilled, garnish and serve.

name: Pink Lady
method: Shake ingredients very well with ice and strain into cocktail glass. Garnish with a cherry.

name: Piña Colada
method: Mix with crushed ice in blender until smooth. Pour into chilled glass, garnish and serve.

name: Pisco Sour
method: Vigorously shake and strain contents in a cocktail shaker with ice cubes, then pour into glass and garnish with bitters.

name: Planter's Punch
method: Pour all ingredients, except the bitters, into shaker filled with ice. Shake well. Pour into large glass, filled with ice. Add Angostura bitters, "on top". Garnish with cocktail cherry and pineapple.

name: Polar Bear
method: Shake all ingredients with ice. Serve in a shot glass with a mint leaf as garnish. Can also be served on the rocks

name: Porto Flip
method: Shake ingredients together in a mixer with ice. Strain into glass, garnish and serve

name: Powerscourt
method: Shake ingredients together with ice, and strain into a cocktail glass.

name: Prince of Wales
method: Blend and then pour into a champagne glass and fill with champagne.

name: Quentão

ingredients.name: Peel of two oranges and a lime
Cloves, cinnamon and ginger to taste

method: Caramelize the sugar with the spices and peels, then add the liquids. Boil for a few minutes then serve hot.

name: Quick Fuck
method: Layer ingredients in a shot glass with Kahlua at the bottom and Baileys at the top

name: Ramos Gin Fizz
method:
All ingredients except the soda are poured in a mixing glass, dry shaken (no ice) for two minutes, then ice is added and shaken hard for another minute

Strained into a highball glass without ice and topped with soda

name: Readheaded slut
method: Combine Jägermeister and schnapps in glass full of ice. Add cranberry juice to fill to top. Stir as necessary.

name: Red Russian
method: Pour vodka, then Cherry Heering over ice.

name: Rickey

ingredients.name: Half of a lime squeezed and dropped in the glass

method: Combine spirit, lime and shell in a highball or wine glass. Add ice, stir and then add sparkling mineral water.

name: Rob Roy
garnish: Two maraschino cherries on a skewer (standard version), or lemon twist (perfect and dry versions)
method: Stirred over ice, strained into a chilled glass, garnished, and served straight up, or mixed in rocks glass, filled with ice.

name: Rose Kennedy
method: Add ingredients to an Old Fashioned glass. Stir before serving

name: Rose
method: Shake together in a cocktail shaker, then strain into chilled glass. Garnish and serve.

name: Royal Arrival
method: Shake ingredients together with ice, and strain into a cocktail glass.

name: Royce

ingredients.name: slice of each fresh orange, lemon and lime.

method: In a mixing glass, mix sugar and fruit slices and press to juice fruit, add ice, guava juice and cachaça, mix again - pour into tall glass.

name: Rum Swizzle
garnish: Slice of orange and a cherry
method: Mix in pitcher with crushed ice, shake vigorously until a frothing head appears. Strain into cocktail glasses. Garnish with a slice of orange and a cherry. Serves 6.

name: Russian Spring Punch
method: Pour the ingredients into an highball glass, top with Sparkling wine.

name: Rusty Nail
method: Pour all ingredients directly into old-fashioned glass filled with ice. Stir gently. Garnish with a lemon twist. Serve.

name: Sake Bomb
drinkware: A pint glass and a shot glass
method: The shot of sake is dropped into the beer, causing it to fizz violently. The drink should then be consumed immediately.

name: Salty Dog
method: Shake gin and grapefruit juice in cocktail shaker. Strain into a salt-rimmed highball glass.

name: Savoy Affair
method: Shake ingredients (excepting champagne) together with ice, and strain into a cocktail glass, and fill with champagne and garnish.

name: Savoy Corpse Reviver
method: Shake ingredients together with ice, and strain into a cocktail glass.

name: Savoy Royale
method: Liquidise, strain into a champagne glass and fill with champagne.

name: Sazerac
method:
Rinse a chilled old-fashioned glass with the absinthe, add crushed ice, and set it aside.

Stir the remaining ingredients over ice and set it aside. Discard the ice and any excess absinthe from the prepared glass, and strain the drink into the glass. Add the lemon peel for garnish.

name: Screwdriver
method: Mix in a highball glass with ice. Garnish and serve.

name: Sea Breeze
method: Build all ingredients in a highball glass filled with ice. Garnish with lime wedge.

name: Sex on the Beach
method: Build all ingredients in a highball glass filled with ice. Garnish with orange slice.

name: Sidecar
method: Pour all ingredients into cocktail shaker filled with ice. Shake well and strain into cocktail glass.

name: Singapore Sling
method: Pour all ingredients into cocktail shaker filled with ice cubes. Shake well. Strain into highball glass. Garnish with pineapple and cocktail cherry.

name: Skittle Bomb
method: The Cointreau is poured into a shot glass, and the shot glass is then dropped into the Red Bull.

name: Slippery Nipple
method: Pour the Sambuca into a shot glass, then pour the Baileys on top so that the two liquids do not mix.

name: Snakebite
method: Mix in equal volumes in a standard pint glass

name: Springbokkie
method: The Crème de menthe is poured into the shot glass and the Amarula is carefully layered on top.

name: Spritz Veneziano
method: Build into glass over ice, garnish and serve.

name: Staten Island Ferry
method: Stir together and serve over ice.

name: Stinger
method: Pour in a mixing glass with ice, stir and strain into a cocktail glass. May also be served on rocks in a rocks glass.

name: Tequila Sunrise
method: Pour the tequila and orange juice into glass over ice. Add the grenadine, which will sink to the bottom. Stir gently to create the sunrise effect. Garnish and serve.

name: The Blenheim
method: Shake ingredients together with ice, and strain into a cocktail glass.

name: The Ed Shelly
method: Shake ingredients together. Serve straight or with one ice cube

name: The Last Word
method: Shake with ice and strain into a cocktail glass.

name: Three Wise Men
method: Mix in an old fashioned glass

name: Tinto de verano
method: Mix and serve well chilled.

name: Tom Collins
method: Mix the gin, lemon juice and sugar syrup in a tall glass with ice, top up with soda water, garnish and serve.

name: Tommy's Margarita
method: Shake and strain into a chilled cocktail glass.

name: Tschunk
method: Dice limes and muddle with brown sugar in a highball. Add crushed ice and pour the rum over. Top with mate

name: Tuxedo
method: Stir all ingredients with ice and strain into a cocktail glass. Garnish with a cherry and a twist of lemon zest.

name: Vampiro

ingredients.name: few slices red hot chili peppers

method: Stirring gently, pour all ingredients into highball glass. Garnish.

name: Vesper
method: Shake over ice until well chilled, then strain into a deep goblet and garnish with a thin slice of lemon peel.

name: Vodka Martini
method: Straight: Pour all ingredients into mixing glass with ice cubes. Stir well. Strain in chilled martini cocktail glass. Squeeze oil from lemon peel onto the drink, or garnish with olive.

name: Ward 8
method: Shake the rye whiskey, lemon juice, orange juice, and grenadine with ice; then strain into a chilled cocktail glass. Garnish with a maraschino cherry, if desired. Originally the drink was decorated with a small paper Massachusetts flag.

name: Whiskey sour
method: Shake with ice. Strain into chilled glass, garnish and serve.

name: Whisky Mac
method: Pour both of the ingredients into a wine goblet with no ice. A hot version can also be made, akin to a hot toddy, made with the addition of boiling water.

name: White Lady
method: Add all ingredients into cocktail shaker filled with ice. Shake well and strain into large cocktail glass.

name: White Russian
method: Pour coffee liqueur and vodka into an Old Fashioned glass filled with ice. Float fresh cream on top and stir slowly.

name: Wolfram
method: Shake ingredients together with ice, and strain into a cocktail glass.

name: Woo Woo
method: Build all ingredients in a highball glass filled with ice. Garnish with lime wedge.

name: Yellow Bird
method: Shake and strain into a chilled cocktail glass

name: Yorsh
method: Mix thoroughly and drink quickly.

name: Zombie
method: Mix ingredients other than the 151 in a shaker with ice. Pour into glass and top with the high-proof rum.
